task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 115°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building height I need to see the roofline and ground contact clearly, so I will tilt the camera up while keeping the same heading toward the building.
The view is now facing north instead of toward the target building at ~115° SE, so I need to yaw right to re-align to ~115° while keeping the upward pitch.
I still need a clear view of the top of the building to estimate its height, so I will tilt upward while staying aimed at 115°.
The heading reset to 0° again, so I must rotate back to the target direction (~115°) while keeping the upward pitch to include the roofline.
To estimate height I need both the building base and roof in frame, so I'll pitch up moderately and then can adjust back down if needed.
The view keeps resetting to 0° after pitching, so I need to rotate to 115° SE again to keep the building centered for measurement.
Since pitching causes a heading reset, I'll keep pitch at 0° and instead move laterally to get a better view of the building’s full facade and roofline for a height estimate.
